<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1+"
    pfs=""
>
[Tanglefoot Bag](/Equipment.aspx?ID=78)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Bomb" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=21" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 545 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Strike</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.

 On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

 The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 [Interact](/Actions.aspx?ID=80) actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

level="2"

pfs="Standard"
>
Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Price** 3 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The target takes a –10-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 17.

pfs="Standard"
>
Tanglefoot Bag (Major)
</title>

<traits>

</row>

</column>

You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –20-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 37.
